com.codename1.rad.nodes

Class FormNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codename1.rad.models.Attribute<T>
      • com.codename1.rad.nodes.Node
        • com.codename1.rad.nodes.FormNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionCategories, Iterable<SectionNode>

    public class FormNode
extends Node
implements Iterable<SectionNode>, ActionCategories

    A node that encapsulates form (not a Form, a small "f" form) for editing the properties of an Entity. Forms can contain sections (SectionNode), which can contain fields (FieldNode). If fields are added directly to a FormNode, it actually wraps them in an implicit SectionNode which is the "global" section.

    Supported Attributes

    There isn’t a fixed list of supported attributes, but the following are some of the common attributes you’d find in a form.

    1. ActionsNode - Actions to be added at various locations in the form. Can contain multiple ActionsNode attributes.

      1. Categories include: ActionCategories.OVERFLOW_MENU, ActionCategories.BOTTOM_LEFT_MENU, ActionCategories.BOTTOM_RIGHT_MENU, ActionCategories.TOP_LEFT_MENU, ActionCategories.TOP_RIGHT_MENU.

    2. SectionNode - Can contain multiple section nodes.

      1. All attributes supported by SectionNode will be accepted by FormNode, as they will be wrapped in an implicit SectionNode which is the global section.

    Example

    The following is an example of a UI descriptor for editing a "Person" entity.

    A UI descriptor for a form to edit a "Person" entity
    package com.codename1.demos.ddddemo;

import com.codename1.rad.ui.UI;
import com.codename1.rad.nodes.ActionNode;
import static com.codename1.demos.ddddemo.PersonEntityType.*;
import com.codename1.ui.FontImage;
import static com.codename1.ui.FontImage.MATERIAL_DELETE;
import static com.codename1.rad.nodes.FormNode.OVERFLOW_MENU;
import static com.codename1.rad.nodes.FormNode.BOTTOM_RIGHT_MENU;
import static com.codename1.rad.nodes.FormNode.TOP_LEFT_MENU;


public class PersonEditor extends UI {

   // Define some actions
   public static ActionNode
       deleteAction = action(
           label("Delete"),
           description("Delete this user"),
           icon(MATERIAL_DELETE)
       ),
       showContactsAction = action(
           label("Open Contacts"),
           description("Show all contacts"),
           icon(FontImage.MATERIAL_CONTACTS)
       ),
       printAction = action(
           label("Print"),
           description("Print this page"),
           icon(FontImage.MATERIAL_PRINT)
       );

   {


       // Define the root form.
       form(
           actions(OVERFLOW_MENU, deleteAction, printAction),  (1)
           actions(TOP_LEFT_MENU, deleteAction, printAction, showContactsAction), (2)
           actions(BOTTOM_RIGHT_MENU, deleteAction, printAction), (3)
           editable(true),
           description("Please edit the person's information in the fields below"),
           label("Person Details"),
           columns(2),
           textField(
               label("Name"),
               description("Please enter your name"),
               tags(Person.name)
           ),
           textField(
               tags(description)
           ),
           comboBox(
               tags(DemoTags.hairColor)
           ),
           section(
               actions(TOP_LEFT_MENU, deleteAction, printAction),
               columns(1),
               label("Section 2"),
               textArea(
                   tags(DemoTags.userProfile)
               ),
               table(actions(OVERFLOW_MENU, deleteAction, printAction),
                  label("Quick Links"),
                  description("Useful links related to this person"),
                  editable(true),
                  //property(quicklinks),
                  tags(com.codename1.rad.schemas.Person.url),
                  columns(new QuickLinkEditor().getAllFields())
               )
           )

       );

}}

    1. We add an overflow menu to the form.

    2. Add some actions to the top-left menu.

    3. Add some actions to the bottom-right menu.

    Notice how succinct, yet readable this code is. We can convert this into an actual view with the following:

    new EntityEditor(entity, new PersonEditor());

    And the result:

    Figure 1. The UI generated from the above UI descriptor. All fields are bound to the entity, so changes to the entity will instantly update the UI, and vice-versa.

      • findAttribute

        public Attribute findAttribute(Class type)
        Description copied from class: Node

        Returns an attribute of the given type for this node. If this is a proxy node, it will first check its own attributes. If none is found, it will check the node that it is proxying for the attribute.

        Overrides:
        findAttribute in class Node
        Parameters:
        type - The attribute type.
        Returns:
        The attribute, or null, if this node doesn’t have an attribute of this type.
